Job Title: Group Product Director- Consumer

Location: Horsham, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
Description:

Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine is recruiting for a Group Product Director located in Horsham, PA.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

The Group Product Director, Consumer Marketing for Psoriatic is a critical position within the Immunology Marketing team and will be responsible for the overarching Consumer and Advocacy strategies for Rheumatology and Dermatology. The GPD will be directly responsible for all aspects of the brand patient experience including brand education to patients, DTC advertising, and advocacy relations. The position works closely with HCP marketing team, the PECS organization as well as Agency Partners, Media Excellence, Market Research, Advocacy and Communications. The scope of the role requires strong teamwork, collaboration, and alignment of strategies across multiple stakeholders to understand business impact and deliver on business objectives. This person will lead and develop a team of 4 direct reports and be responsible for strategic development and execution of a large multi-channel campaign with significant media budget.

Key responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:

Leading patient experience strategy to create a bold advantage for brandDeveloping and executing patient education strategy (branded and unbranded)Leading development of integrated and multi-channel DTC campaign and evolutionLeading consumer/patient agency of record and other specialty agencies to implement DTC strategy/tacticsPartnering with the Advocacy team and Patient advocates to implement strategy aligned to key business objectivesPartnering with PR/Communications team on external communications initiatives and signature campaignsManaging DTC budgets, including all aspects of agency and media spendOverseeing tactical execution of direct reports; Provide coaching, development, and day-to-day management of direct reportsAligning with HCP team to ensure all messaging is cohesive of efficacy/safety + access through personal and non-personal promotionProviding timely and relevant updates to field sales team on DTC tactics and patient education resources

Qualifications:

This individual must demonstrate strong leadership presence through influencing without authority with high-level management, detailed orientation, and excellent strategic thinking. This position requires extensive interactions with multiple stakeholders.

Education:

A minimum of a Bachelor's degree is required. Postgraduate qualification, MBA, or other graduate degree is strongly preferred.

Required:

A minimum of 10 years of business experience in the pharmaceutical industry with a minimum of 5 years demonstrated in-line marketing, executing marketing strategyA demonstrated ability to partner and work with multiple agencies/vendors, manage budgets and projects, cross-functionally, cross-geography, and with cross-company teams of high-level managers and executivesAn ability to manage multiple demands and priorities on time, lead teams, gain alignment and driving decision makingStrong verbal and written communication skills are required along with demonstrated presentation skills.Strong executive communication skillsAbility to work the hybrid/flex schedule of 3 days a week in the Horsham, PA office and travel up to 25%.

Preferred:

Prior experience in pharmaceutical patient/consumer marketing, including large campaign/TV shoots, media strategy and data-driven content strategy and creationExperience working with customers and translating customer needs to the broader organization.Demonstrated ability to formally manage, coach, and develop direct reports.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.

Experience Level (if available): None
